response.homeDescription:
We're relocating for a job, and sadly have to part ways with our lovely condo. We've truly appreciated living here, and know you will too! Located in East Lakeview (between Sheffield and Halstead), just a few blocks from the Addison Red Line, and convenient to Lakeshore Drive/Halsted buses, which makes commuting anywhere a breeze.
The details: 1bd/1ba, 950 SQ FT Unfurnished Short Term (5month) or Long Term(12 month) lease Top floor unit (3rd floor) Large, open layout living space with a reading/office nook High Ceilings! In-unit Washer & Dryer Rear Deck Large bedroom (fits King or Queen easily) Large Walk-In closet Dishwasher Central A/C & Heat (new furnace installed spring 2017) Fireplace (we never used, but told it works) Extra Storage Unit (8X10) in basement Bike Racks, additional shared laundry also in basement. Permitted Street Parking available
Looking to sublet the remainder of our lease, 5 months October 1st- end of February (Option to sign a new lease now or in Feb) Rent is $1850, and utilities have averaged 60-70 per month. No deposit, but you'd have to submit an application through our landlord, which we'd help coordinate. I believe a small pet would be allowed, but also not our call.
Quiet Building, independently owned units = people who care about their surroundings, but mind their own business:) Access to Lake! 10-15 minute walk to Belmont Harbor Whole Foods 2 blocks up Halstead. Mariano's 1/2 mile down Broadway. Transportation-We're a couple that share a car, but hardly ever use it. 2 block walk to Addison beats parking anywhere near downtown. Endless supply of bars and restaurants within walking or $5 uber distance, whatever your scene may be. Safe-never felt uneasy walking around this neighborhood, and Lakeview in general. Responsive, local owners- we only had to contact once for a sink clog, and they were on it. 2 blocks to Wrigley Field, if that's your thing. If not, the crowds on gamedays aren't as big of a deal as I imagined.
Happy to show most days/eves!
Owner pays for sewer, water, trash. Tenant pays for electric.

response.homeDescription:
Bring your architect to this stately 1880 Greystone in Chicago's prestigious Gold Coast neighborhood. Priced to sell, this home offers approximately 4,900 square feet of living space with four bedrooms, three full and two half baths, and an attached heated garage (a precious commodity in the Gold Coast). Highlights include 11 foot ceilings, oak floors with insets, the original restored oak staircase, crown and picture molding, recessed and chandelier lighting, multiple skylights, decorative antique fireplaces, and updated baths. Modernize and renovate the vintage interior or expand the home!
You enter through a dedicated foyer into the spacious living room with recessed lighting and a fireplace with marble surround. The large formal dining room is situated behind the grand central staircase and features another fireplace and a chandelier.
The kitchen offers generous white cabinetry and counter space plus stainless steel appliances. An adjoining breakfast room features a barrel vaulted skylight. The family room has a wall of built-in bookcases, built-in bench seating, a fireplace, and a circular skylight.
The master suite occupies the full third level; it includes tall north-facing windows, a huge walk-in closet, and a spa bath with a soaking tub, linen closet, and a private commode with a walk-in shower. Two well-proportioned bedrooms and a hall bath are together on the second level.
The lower level offers a guest bedroom and bath, a kitchen, and a storage room. It has a separate front entrance making it an ideal in-law or nanny apartment.
71 E. Bellevue's stellar location offers access to some of Chicago's finest amenities. Michigan Avenue shopping and dining, Rush Street nightlife, Oak Street boutiques, the 18-mile lakefront trail, and Oak Street Beach are all just steps away. Several grocery stores and a seasonal favorite, the Division Street Farmers Market, are nearby. This home is in the attendance area of highly rated Ogden Elementary and Lincoln Park High School.
Transportation to the Loop and throughout the North Side is made easy by Lake Shore Drive, two nearby Red Line subway stations, and several local and express bus routes.
If you think this home might be right for you, please call or email us. We are standing by to answer your questions or schedule a time for you to walk through with a member of our team.

response.homeDescription: Own a coveted 2 bedroom upper floor south-facing end-unit in East Lakeview, 1 block from the lake! Bathroom was renovated in May 2017 and has new tile and a new toilet. Large foyer greets guests and has a coat closet. Plumbing pipes replaced throughout the building in 2017-no special assessment. Not suitable for investors-building has a 20% rental cap and is at that cap. response.whatOwnerLoves: 1. The Lake and Lakefront Path: you literally walk out of condo, cross the street and youre at the lake front, which is amazing. Ive spent so much time on the path running, biking, and even rollerblading! 2. This view. I love waking up and falling asleep to this gorgeous view of the city. I will miss it terribly. 3. The Neighborhood; when you walk out of the condo you feel like youre in your own little neighborhood rather than a big city because of the tree lined streets and beautiful homes. 4. Not having to drive! Coming home after a long day and knowing that you don't need to get into car to get ANYTHING as EVERYTHING you could need is within a 5 minute walk is priceless. 5. Groceries; You are within 5 minutes of no less than 3 major grocery stores (Treasure Island, Whole Foods, and Jewel). Forgetting something you need in the kitchen is no big deal when you live this close. 6. Shopping; I can't imagine what I could need to buy that I can't find at 1 of the hundreds of stores (new or used) within a 15 minute walk - with no parking hassles. 7. Bus 146; I never thought I'd enjoy public transportation as much as I do, but Bus 146 which picks up just feet from the condo is an express Bus that takes you to The Mag Mile or down to State Street. Its super easy and convenient. Not to mention it returns you again almost to your front door. 8. Diva Sushi; This hole in the wall is only a 5 minute walk and has fantastic sushi as well as Thai food. Its affordable and offers great quality food. 9. The Condo Association Staff: I cannot imagine that I will ever find a nicer or more helpful group of people, including and especially the front door/security staff. I will miss them all. Can I bring them with me? 10. BYOB; So many amazing restaurants in the area where you can get a great meal at a great price and bring in you own beer or wine. It is AWESOME.

Functional living at its finest with a beautiful galley kitchen boasting glass subway tile backsplash, granite counters, and high-end S/S appliances. Jacuzzi tub in bath and HW floors throughout. Bedroom closet is fitted with mahogany organizers. Full sized W/D in unit and additional storage closet (approx. 10x7). Large deck space off kitchen perfect for grilling and entertaining.
